content: Who was the American aviator that made the first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean in 1927?

The American aviator who made the first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean in 1927 was Charles Lindbergh. His flight, which took place on May 20-21, 1927, was from New York to Paris, covering a distance of about 3,600 miles (5,800 kilometers) in his single-engine airplane, the Spirit of St. Louis. This historic achievement earned him international fame and recognition, and he was awarded the Orteig Prize for completing the flight.
